meanings.definition: A failure to correspond or match
meanings.sent1: The socks I wore today had a mismatch in color.
meanings.sent2: The mismatch between his words and actions confused me.
meanings.sent3: It was a funny mismatch when he tried to wear two different shoes.
meanings.sent4: The mismatch in their opinions created tension in the group.
meanings.sent5: The mismatch in puzzle pieces made it impossible to complete the picture.

meanings.sent1: She accidentally mismatched her outfit for the party.
meanings.sent2: Please don't mismatch the numbers when entering them into the system.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to mismatch the ingredients to create a new dish.
meanings.sent4: His attempt to mismatch the patterns on purpose resulted in a unique design.
meanings.sent5: It's important not to mismatch the keys when assembling the furniture.

meanings.definition: A lack of correspondence or compatibility
meanings.sent1: There was a noticeable mismatch in their personalities.
meanings.sent2: The mismatch in their schedules caused conflicts.
meanings.sent3: The mismatch in their tastes made choosing a movie difficult.
meanings.sent4: The mismatch between their goals led to misunderstandings.
meanings.sent5: The mismatch in their interests became apparent over time.
